doc.name: miterLimit

syntax.example: set the miterLimit [of graphic] to number

doc.summary: Specifies how far miter joins can extend from the meeting point of two edges before a bevel join is used.

examples.example: set the miterLimit of graphic "polygon 1" of this card to 5

description.overview: Set the miterLimit property to specify how far miter joins can extend from the meeting point of two edges before a bevel join is used.

parameter.name: number
parameter.description: An integer that is a multiple of the current lineSize of the graphic.

description.value: The miterLimit property returns an integer that is a multiple of the current lineSize of the graphic.
description.comments:
The miterLimit is used to calculate the maximum size of a miter join before it is rendered as a bevel. The size of a miter join is the length in pixels from the corner to the intersection point of its outer two edges. The miterLimit is specified as a multiple of the current lineSize of the graphic.
This only affects polygon, freehand curve and line graphics which have their antialiased set to true.
